TopicTitle: Is KSPRC and EVE the Only Graphical Overhauls Left?

Articles.Content:
I've been scouring around and it just comes to me that there is nearly all environmental graphical mods are gone for planets. Normally, I would just be satisfied with KSPRC but it's too intensive for my computer to actually compute.

 

What happen to the mid-tier graphical environmental enhancements like Better Atmospheres?

On 08/06/2016 at 0:41 PM, TheRag said:

I've been scouring around and it just comes to me that there is nearly all environmental graphical mods are gone for planets. Normally, I would just be satisfied with KSPRC but it's too intensive for my computer to actually compute.

 

What happen to the mid-tier graphical environmental enhancements like Better Atmospheres?

Have you tried deleting some of the cloud layers (especially volume clouds) - just press Alt-0 (zero) and tweak until you get acceptable performance.

Stock Visual Enhancements, and Stock Sized Real Solar System. SVE is fantastic on its own, and with SSRSS, it gets even better as SSRSS adds even more. Both don't change gameplay. (SSRSS does, but only if you don't install stock inclinations)

As for how they perform, it just depends on which version of SVE you install for either mod. Range from Ultra Low to Ultra High. 

This is what SSRSS looks like:

additional it's needed to say that KSPRC and SVE and other overhauls use EVE (and others) and "just" configure the settings (...and add textures ). so its wrong to list KSPRC along with EVE in the title.

basically EVE, Scatterer, TextureReplacer & Kopernicus are the base for most graphic enhancements.

 

KSPRC and SVE are the most common overhauls that provide their own settings for those (or some of them) tools with the aim to create an even more realistic (or sur-realistic) experience... and not failing at all

 

For KSPRC: its been stated several times, that Kopernicus uses most ressources of the whole package.So if u are locking for others (not all use kopernicus at all), then u should perhaps first try to exclude the kopernicus folder from your KSPRC install and try if u can life with whats left and if the performance is fione for you.
 

Edited June 9, 2016 by Speadge
